intro: Saul tumbuggaia, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss in dry conditions. The flowers, which are usually pink or red, attract nectar-feeding insects and birds.
